boat.construction_details: Carvel, mahogany and pitch pine on oak

for_sales.sales_text:
Gaff Cutter Inanda is now for sale. She was built by Whisstocks in 1949 and is the roomier version that had an extra plank added to her shear as most did after the war. She is a sturdy little pocket cruiser in very good sound condition having had much work done  to her over the years. The sails are excellent and set very well. The engine is a  volvo 10 hp which has been utterly reliable and very economcal. A new sump pan and engine mounts were fitted last year.  The rigging is galvanised wire and sound. Running rigging and blocks were replaced a few years ago and are still excellent.

Down below there are to full length berths with room for one in the fo"c"sle.  To port is a two burner Origo meths stove. To starboard there is a hanging locker.

Inanda sails really well for her size and has done well in local OGA races. A very handy  yacht.

Seriously for sale- too many boat and projects. Would consider sensible offer.

boat.full_description:
Gaff cutter 'Inanda' was built by Whisstocks in 1949 and is the roomier version that had an extra plank added to her shear as most did after the war. She is a sturdy little pocket cruiser in very good sound condition having had much work done  to her over the years. The sails are excellent and set very well. The engine is a  Volvo 10hp which has been utterly reliable and very economcal. A new sump pan and engine mounts were fitted in 2017. The rigging is galvanised wire and sound with running rigging and blocks replaced around 2010.

Down below there are two full length berths with room for one in the fo'c'sle.  To port is a two burner Origo meths stove. To starboard there is a hanging locker. 'Inanda' sails really well for her size and has competed successfully in local OGA races.
boat.name: Inanda
boat.short_description: Inanda is a Deben four-tonner, built at Woodbridge in 1949.
